item.description: Our article in Nikkei Business on reducing Japanese malapportionment was released!

item.title: Widespread Partisan Gerrymandering Mostly Cancels Nationally, but Reduces Electoral Competition
item.dc:creator: Christopher T. Kenny
Cory McCartan
Tyler Simko
Shiro Kuriwaki
Kosuke Imai
item.description: Gerrymandering in 2020 redistricting makes the US House elections less competitive, but net seat gains are small nationally. The partisan bias of the enacted national map is about as biased as non-partisan simulations, due to geography and legal requirements.

item.description: In attempting to protect the privacy of 2020 Census respondents, the Census Bureau has made its data unsuitable for redistricting purposes.
